Key Match Events: Denver Nuggets head coach Michael Malone praised Russell Westbrook's defensive effort in their 124-122 home win over the Oklahoma City Thunder.
Russell Westbrook led Denver with 29 points on 10-of-15 shooting, along with six assists, six rebounds, and one steal.
The Thunder were undefeated at 7-0 entering the contest, with stars Shai Gilgeous-Alexander, Chet Holmgren, and Jalen Williams playing full minutes.
Denver used an eight-man rotation, with all five starters playing at least 32 minutes.
Post-Match Reflections: Michael Malone expressed appreciation for Westbrook's effort and discipline, highlighting his commitment to the team.
Westbrook's performance was crucial in overcoming the absence of Jamal Murray and Aaron Gordon due to injury.
